snippet: Critics say Gay Men’s Health Crisis, the nation’s first group dedicated to the prevention of H.I.V./AIDS, has lost its sense of urgency in combating the disease.
abstract: Gay Men's Health Crisis, nation’s first group dedicated to the prevention of HIV/AIDS, struggles to stay relevant as critics say it has lost its sense of urgency in combating disease; recent resignation of Dr Marjorie J Hill, who led group for seven years, has renewed spotlight on 30-year-old organization and debate over best ways to use its influence and focus.
lead_paragraph: Critics say Gay Men’s Health Crisis, the nation’s first group dedicated to the prevention of H.I.V./AIDS, has lost its sense of urgency in combating the disease.

headline.main: A Pioneering AIDS Prevention Group Struggles to Stay Relevant
headline.print_headline: More Than 30 Years After Birth, AIDS Prevention Group Struggles to Stay Relevant
